SEARCH
Module com.example.notesmanager
Package com.example.notesmanager

Class Note

java.lang.Object
com.example.notesmanager.Note
public class Note extends Object
Represents a note in a tab in a note-taking application. It contains methods to get and set the note's properties, and to interact with the database.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Note

      public Note(Tab tab, int noteID, String noteName, String noteLabel1, String noteLabel2)
      Constructor for the Note class. It sets the noteID, tabID, noteName, noteLabel1, and noteLabel2.
      Parameters:
      tab - The Tab object that this Note belongs to.
      noteID - The unique identifier for this Note.
      noteName - The name of this Note.
      noteLabel1 - The first label of this Note.
      noteLabel2 - The second label of this Note.

    • Note

      public Note(int noteID, int tabId, String noteName, String noteContent, String noteLabel1, String noteLabel2)
      This constructor creates a new Note object with a given noteName, tabName and binderName.
      Parameters:
      noteName - The Tab object that this Note belongs to.

    • Note

      public Note(Tab tab, int noteID, String noteName, String noteContent, String noteLabel1, String noteLabel2)
      This constructor creates a new Note object with a given Tab, noteID, noteName, and noteContent. The noteID, noteName, and noteContent are directly assigned, while the tabID is retrieved from the given Tab object.
      Parameters:
      tab - The Tab object that this Note belongs to.
      noteID - The unique identifier for this Note.
      noteName - The name of this Note.
      noteContent - The content of this Note.

    • fetchNoteContent

      public void fetchNoteContent()
      Fetches the content of this Note from the database. If the noteContent is null, it queries the database for the note content using the note's ID. The result is then assigned to the noteContent.

    • fetchNoteContentByNoteName

      public static ResultSet fetchNoteContentByNoteName(String noteName, String tabName, String binderName)

    • editName

      public int editName(String newName)
      Edits the name of this Note. It updates the note name in the database and returns the result of the update operation.
      Parameters:
      newName - The new name for this Note.
      Returns:
      The result of the update operation. Typically, the number of rows affected.

    • editContent

      public int editContent(String newContent)
      Edits the content of this Note. It updates the note content in the database and returns the result of the update operation.
      Parameters:
      newContent - The new content for this Note.
      Returns:
      The result of the update operation. Typically, the number of rows affected.
